name: opaque
content:

preventing light from travelling through, and therefore not transparent or translucent: opaque glass/tights
formal Opaque writing or speech is difficult to understand: I find her poetry a little too opaque.

(of a substance) preventing light from traveling through, and therefore not allowing you to see through it: opaque watercolors
Opaque also means difficult to understand: The majority of readers found his poetry difficult, even opaque.

difficult to understand or know about, especially because things have been intentionally kept secret or made complicated: Governments have been able to maintain opaque and discriminatory procurement practices. Accounting firms have been notoriously opaque about their finances in the past. Compare
transparent
